law.catch_line: The sheriff shall suspend a license if the licensee fails to comply with the reporting requirements ...

section.section: The sheriff shall suspend a license if the licensee fails to comply with the reporting requirements of § 13-2504 of this subtitle.
The suspension shall continue until the licensee meets the reporting requirements of § 13-2504 of this subtitle.

text.section:
Except as provided in subsection (a) of this section and subject to the procedures provided in subsection (c) of this section, the sheriff may not issue a new license for 1 year to a licensee that:
has refused to file a report required under § 13-2504 of this subtitle; or
has failed to comply with this subtitle.

section.section: The sheriff shall notify the licensee or applicant for a license by registered mail of the sheriff's suspension or refusal to issue a license.
The licensee or applicant may appeal the decision in writing to the sheriff within 30 days after receiving the notice from the sheriff.
